l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a time you got lost in a strange place. You should say:
Where you were
Who you were with
How you felt
And explain how you found your way.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'd like to describe a time I was completely Disoriented [迷失方向的] in Tokyo. I was on a holiday trip with my younger brother. The streets were Unfamiliar [不熟悉的] and very crowded with people. Since we had no internet map, we started Go around in circles [原地打转] for an hour. I felt quite Panicked [惊慌失措的] because it was getting dark and cold. Thankfully, a Helpful [有帮助的] local student stopped and showed us the way to the station. I was so Relieved [如释重负的] to arrive at our hotel Safe and sound [安然无恙]. It felt like a Lost cause [注定失败的事] at first, but we made it back.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Place: Tokyo / Forest
- With: Friend / Alone
- Felt: Scared / Tired
- How: Map / Ask

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a helpful person who gave you directions. You should say:
Who the person was
Where it happened
What they did
And explain why they were helpful.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'm going to talk about a police officer who was extremely Helpful [有帮助的]. It happened in Paris when I was completely Disoriented [迷失方向的] near the tower. I was looking for a specific museum in an Unfamiliar [不熟悉的] neighborhood. Although I felt like finding it was a Lost cause [没救了], he patiently drew me a map. He was Versatile [多功能的] and spoke English very well. I was Relieved [如释重负的] because I was previously Go around in circles [原地打转] for ages. Thanks to him, I got there Safe and sound [安然无恙]. His clear instructions stopped me from being Panicked [惊慌失措的] any longer.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Person: Police / Local
- Where: Street / Station
- Did: Showed map
- Why: Kind / Clear

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a map or app you use for directions. You should say:
What it is
How often you use it
How it works
And explain why you like it.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I wish to talk about Google Maps, which is a highly Versatile [多功能的] tool on my phone. I use it daily because the city streets are often Unfamiliar [不熟悉的] to me. It gives clear directions so I never feel Disoriented [迷失方向的] while driving. Because it is Compact [小巧的] and accurate, I never have to Go around in circles [原地打转] anymore. I like it because it keeps me Safe and sound [安然无恙] on the road. Without it, finding new places would be a Lost cause [注定失败的事]. It prevents me from getting Panicked [惊慌失措的] when driving in heavy traffic.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- App: Google Maps
- Use: Daily / Trips
- Works: GPS / Voice
- Like: Fast / Free

l2_part3_questions.question: How do people navigate without technology?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective [观点/视角], they rely on traditional skills and awareness. [Reason] They use paper maps and their own mental Orientation [方向感] to find the way effectively. [Example] Unless they have good Intuition [直觉], they might get lost without GPS to guide them. However, using physical Landmarks [地标] is a reliable method. It takes practice to master this skill.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Ask people. Reason: Locals know. Example: Asking a shopkeeper.

l2_part3_questions.question: Is it good to rely on GPS?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] It seems to me that heavy Reliance [依赖] on GPS is risky. [Reason] If the battery dies or signal is lost, you are helpless. [Example] While Navigation [导航] apps are useful, we should also learn to Find one's feet [适应新环境] naturally in new places. We shouldn't be afraid to go Off the beaten track [人迹罕至] sometimes without digital help. It builds confidence and independence.

l2_part3_questions.question: Why do some people have a bad sense of direction?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe it relates to their natural spatial awareness. [Reason] Some people struggle with mental Orientation [方向感] and cannot visualize maps easily. [Example] Since they lack Intuition [直觉] for directions, they get lost easily without visible Landmarks [地标]. It can be a real Distraction [分心] for them while driving safely. They tend to panic more easily.

l2_part3_questions.question: How can we improve our sense of direction?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I think the best way is to practice walking without phones. [Reason] We should try to memorize the route and turns before leaving the house. [Example] Provided that we pay attention to Landmarks [地标], our Navigation [导航] skills will improve over time. You can Cross that bridge when you come to it [船到桥头自然直] if you get lost. Practice helps us build mental maps.

l2_part3_questions.question: What are the dangers of getting lost?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, the main danger is physical safety. [Reason] Being lost in a Virtual [虚拟的] game is fine, but real wilderness is dangerous. [Example] Even though you might eventually find help, panic can cause Distraction [分心] and accidents on the road. You must stay calm to survive. Always tell someone your plans before traveling into nature.

l2_part3_questions.question: Do tourists face more problems with directions?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I think they certainly do face more challenges. [Reason] Orientation [方向感] is much harder in a completely new city or country. [Example] Whereas locals Find one's feet [站稳脚跟] easily, tourists often go Off the beaten track [人迹罕至] by mistake. Heavy Reliance [依赖] on maps is common for them. It is part of the adventure of traveling abroad.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Signs. Reason: Language. Example: Can't read street names.
